content.rendered:
The ODEI would like to share resources with you to help educate around issues of power, privilege, oppression, and racism. The information shared below is presented in multiple ways (articles/books to read, videos/webinars to watch, and podcasts to listen to). Join the ULV community as we learn and grow together to help combat injustices, call out racism, advocate for equitable systems, and fight for change.

Readings

  • 10 things you can do to stop white supremacy
  • 10 ways well-meaning white teachers bring racism into our schools
  • 11 Ways White America Avoids Taking Responsibility for its Racism
  • 21 Racial Microaggressions you hear on a daily basis
  • 6 Harmful consequences of the white savior complex
  • A Call to Action
  • A letter to my son
  • Anti-racism resources for white people
  • Barriers and Strategies by White Faculty Who Incorporate Anti-Racist Pedagogy
  • Challenging the invisibility of Asian Americans in Education
  • Dismantling the White Supremacy Embedded in our Classrooms: White Faculty in Pursuit of More Equitable Educational Outcomes for Racially Minoritized Students
  • Climbing the white escalator
  • Explaining white privilege to a broke white person
  • Get it wrong for me: What I need from allies
  • Guide to allyship
  • History of Racial Injustice
  • History of the Civil Rights Movement
  • How to Respond to Racial Microaggressions When They Occur
  • How to tell if you’ve been unintentionally racist
  • It’s not just the south: here’s how everyone can resist white supremacy
  • Resources to understand America’s long history of injustice and inequality
  • Stamped from the beginning: the definitive history of racist ideas in America (book)
  • What if Instead of Calling People Out, We Called Them In?
  • What is settler-colonialism
  • When Affirmative Action was white (book)
  • White Americans Need to Condemn White Racism in America
  • White Fragility: Why it’s so hard for white people to talk about racism (book)
  • White privilege: unpacking the invisible knapsack

Watch or Listen

  • #GoodMuslimBadMuslim
  • All of the Above Podcast – (episode 53) Asian Americans, Education, and the Fight for Justice
  • Anti-Black Racism and allyship (video)
  • Black Gaze Podcast
  • Black Girl in Maine – Unpack whiteness and how it operates (podcast)
  • Breakdances with Wolves (podcast)
  • Code Switch(podcast)
  • Color blind or color brave?
  • For people of color who aren’t Black (video)
  • Intersectionality Matters!
  • Kwanzaa Spectacular
  • Robin DiAngelo discusses “White Fragility”
  • Seeing White Series (Scene of Radio)
  • Speak out with Tim Wise
  • Teaching While White
  • The Anti-Racism Daily Podcast
  • The Neuroscience of Bias
  • Video: Birth of a white nation
  • Video: Confronting “intergroup anxiety”
  • Video:  How I learned to stop worrying and love discussing Race
  • Video: How to overcome our biases
  • Video: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
  • Video: I didn’t tell you
  • Video: NY Times op-docs on race
  • Video: Stand 4 what
  • Video: Taking on White Privilege
  • Video: The danger of a single story
  • Video: The disturbing history of the suburbs
  • Video: This is America
  • Video: True Colors
  • Video: What kind of Asian are you?
  • Video: what would you do: Bicycle thief
  • Video: White Bred
  • Video/Read: Racism is Real
  • Videos:  Ted Talks to help you understand racism in America

Take

  • Project Implicit test
  • Video: Test your awareness: do the test
  • Racialized Trauma Course (free/online)
